briefdescription.para: Success (used by unit tests that assert IE_OK).
Label for weight-only INT8 precision hint ("int8w").
Label for weight-only INT4 precision hint ("int4w").
Convenience alias accepted by the CLI; normalized to "int4w".

detaileddescription.para: The engine copies provided parameters by value. Unknown hints are ignored.

p
Optional parameters (may be NULL for defaults).
out
Output engine handle; must be non-NULL.
IE_OK
on success.
non-zero
on failure (resource error, invalid args, etc).

CI-friendly behavior:
Does not open or validate model files.
Fails only on allocation/invalid-argument errors.
“Model required” is enforced by the CLI when IE_REQUIRE_MODEL=1.

memberdef.argsstring: (ie_engine_t *h, const char *prompt, size_t max_new_tokens, uint32_t *out_tokens, uint32_t *out_count)
memberdef.name: ie_engine_generate

briefdescription.para: Generate up to max_new_tokens from prompt.

detaileddescription.para: Implementations may output fewer tokens (e.g., due to EOS). The caller owns the out_tokens buffer and must supply capacity for max_new_tokens.

h
Engine handle.
prompt
NUL-terminated prompt text.
max_new_tokens
Upper bound on tokens to produce.
out_tokens
Output buffer for token IDs (size >= max_new_tokens).
out_count
Number of tokens actually produced (<= max_new_tokens).
IE_OK
on success.
non-zero
on failure.
Generate up to max_new_tokens from prompt.
Implementations may output fewer tokens (e.g., due to EOS). The caller owns the out_tokens buffer and must supply capacity for max_new_tokens.

h

prompt

max_new_tokens

out_count

IE_OK
on success.
non-zero
on failure.
Generate up to max_new_tokens from prompt.

listitem.para: If max_new_tokens == 0, nothing is written and *out_count becomes 0.
On success, *out_count equals the number of tokens produced (≤ max).
Output is deterministic for identical (engine seed, prompt).

h

out

non-zero

briefdescription.para: Destroy an engine and free its resources.

detaileddescription.para:
h
Engine handle (may be NULL; no-op).
Destroy an engine and free its resources.

h
Engine handle (may be NULL; no-op).
Destroy an engine and free its resources.

briefdescription.para: Public C API for the inference engine (minimal surface used by CLI/tests).

detaileddescription.para: The API surface is intentionally small. Fields like ie_engine_params_t::precision exist as soft hints that backends may honor or ignore.

sect1.title: Precision labels
sect1.para:
The precision hint is a string label accepted by the CLI/tests to describe the desired numeric pathway. In addition to floating-point labels, two weight-only quantization labels are documented:
"int8w" : weight-only INT8 (activations in fp32/fp16/bf16 as the backend decides)
"int4w" : weight-only INT4 (packed nibbles, symmetric, zero-point = 0)
Engines are free to ignore these hints or to act on them. The CLI never remaps "int4" to "fp32" — when seen, it normalizes to "int4w".
